name: Acid
description: When you take the Attack action, you can replace one of your attacks with throwing a vial of Acid. Target one creature or object you can see within 20 feet of yourself. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Dexterity modifier and Proficiency Bonus) or take 2d6 Acid damage.

name: Alchemist's Fire
description: When you take the Attack action, you can replace one of your attacks with throwing a flask of Alchemist's Fire. Target one creature or object you can see within 20 feet of yourself. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Dexterity modifier and Proficiency Bonus) or take 1d4 Fire damage and start burning.

name: Amulet of Health
description: Your Constitution score is 19 while you wear this amulet. It has no effect on you if your Constitution score is already 19 or higher.

name: Backpack
description: A backpack can hold one cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear. You can also strap items, such as a bedroll or a coil of rope, to the outside of a backpack.

name: Bag of Holding
description:
This bag has an interior space considerably larger than its outside dimensions, roughly 2 feet in diameter at the mouth and 4 feet deep. The bag can hold up to 500 pounds, not exceeding a volume of 64 cubic feet. The bag weighs 15 pounds, regardless of its contents. Retrieving an item from the bag requires an action.

If the bag is overloaded, pierced, or torn, it ruptures and is destroyed, and its contents are scattered in the Astral Plane. If the bag is turned inside out, its contents spill forth, unharmed, but the bag must be put right before it can be used again. Breathing creatures inside the bag can survive up to a number of minutes equal to 10 divided by the number of creatures (minimum 1 minute), after which time they begin to suffocate.

Placing a bag of holding inside an extradimensional space created by a handy haversack, portable hole, or similar item instantly destroys both items and opens a gate to the Astral Plane. The gate originates where the one item was placed inside the other. Any creature within 10 feet of the gate is sucked through it to a random location on the Astral Plane. The gate then closes. The gate is one-way only and can't be reopened.

name: Basic Poison
description: As a Bonus Action, you can use a vial of Basic Poison to coat one weapon or up to three pieces of ammunition. A creature that takes Piercing or Slashing damage from the poisoned weapon or ammunition takes an extra 1d4 Poison damage. Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute or until its damage is dealt, whichever comes first.

name: Battleaxe
description: Like an axe: but for battle.

name: Bedroll
description: You never know where you're going to sleep, and a bedroll helps you get better sleep in a hayloft or on the cold ground. A bedroll consists of bedding and a blanket thin enough to be rolled up and tied. In an emergency, it can double as a stretcher.

name: Belt of Cloud Giant Strength
description: While wearing this belt, your Strength score changes to 27. If your Strength is already equal to or greater than 27, the item has no effect on you.

name: Belt of Fire Giant Strength
description: While wearing this belt, your Strength score changes to 25. If your Strength is already equal to or greater than 25, the item has no effect on you.

name: Belt of Frost Giant Strength
description: While wearing this belt, your Strength score changes to 23. If your Strength is already equal to or greater than 23, the item has no effect on you.

name: Belt of Hill Giant Strength
description: While wearing this belt, your Strength score changes to 21. If your Strength is already equal to or greater than 21, the item has no effect on you.

name: Belt of Stone Giant Strength
description: While wearing this belt, your Strength score changes to 23. If your Strength is already equal to or greater than 23, the item has no effect on you.

name: Belt of Storm Giant Strength
description: While wearing this belt, your Strength score changes to 29. If your Strength is already equal to or greater than 29, the item has no effect on you.

name: Bloodwell Vial +1
description:
To attune to this vial, you must place a few drops of your blood into it. The vial can't be opened while your attunement to it lasts. If your attunement to the vial ends, the contained blood turns to ash. You can use the vial as a spellcasting focus for your spells while wearing or holding it, and you gain a bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your sorcerer spells. The bonus is determined by the vial's rarity.

In addition, when you roll any Hit Dice to recover hit points while you are carrying the vial, you can regain 5 sorcery points. This property of the vial can't be used again until the next dawn.

calculation.value: Bloodwell Vial +1. The spell save DC of your Sorcerer spells increases by 1.
Bloodwell Vial +1. The spell attack bonus of your Sorcerer spells increases by 1.

description:

You can use the vial as a spellcasting focus for your spells while wearing or holding it, and you gain a bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your sorcerer spells. The bonus is determined by the vial's rarity.

In addition, when you roll any Hit Dice to recover hit points while you are carrying the vial, you can regain 5 sorcery points. This property of the vial can't be used again until the next dawn.

calculation.value: Bloodwell Vial +2. The spell save DC of your Sorcerer spells increases by 2.
Bloodwell Vial +2. The spell attack bonus of your Sorcerer spells increases by 2.

To attune to this vial, you must place a few drops of your blood into it. The vial can't be opened while your attunement to it lasts. If your attunement to the vial ends, the contained blood turns to ash. You can use the vial as a spellcasting focus for your spells while wearing or holding it, and you gain a bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your sorcerer spells. The bonus is determined by the vial's rarity.

In addition, when you roll any Hit Dice to recover hit points while you are carrying the vial, you can regain 5 sorcery points. This property of the vial can't be used again until the next dawn.

name: Blowgun
description: A gun that you can blow.

name: Burnt Toast of Fire Resistance

debuff.description: Everything tastes and smells burnt for the next 24 hours making you unable to discern anything that relies on taste or scent.

description: Burnt Toast that upon being consumed (treat it like a potion) grants the consumer fire resistance for 1 hour. However, everything tastes and smells burnt for the next 24 hours making you unable to discern anything that relies on taste or scent.

name: Cartographer's Tools

name: Chain Mail
description: AC: 16. Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets. Stealth. The wearer has disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

calculation.value: Chain Mail. The wearer has disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

name: Club
description: A light weapon is small and easy to handle, making it ideal for use when fighting with two weapons.

name: Cobbler's Tools
utilize: Modify footwear to give Advantage on the wearer's next Dexterity (Acrobatics) check (DC 15)

name: Dagger
description: A light weapon is small and easy to handle, making it ideal for use when fighting with two weapons.

name: Dagger of Friendship
description: Deals Piercing damage to the target equal to 1 + your dexterity modifier, ignoring any Piercing resistence or immunity, but then immediately heals the target the same amount.

name: Dart
description: Bullseye.

name: Derringer
description: A small, low caliber, single-shot handgun. It lacks a moving action, but is easily concealable and quick to draw and stow.

name: Eye Patch
description: Does not help your vision. Quite the opposite. Unless you're actually missing an eye though... In that case, this eye patch might come across a bit intimidating!

calculation.value: Eye Patch. You have disadvantage on ranged attack rolls.
Eye Patch. You have disadvantage on ranged attack rolls.

name: Flail

name: Gnomish Automatic Beard-Trimming Machine
description: Last time it escaped, it killed ten men. When activated, it attacks everyone within 500ft it can see, bringing out the spirits of those it killed to fight for it while it itself goes haywire. Fight 10 gnome shadows and 1 machine.

name: Greataxe
description: Like an axe: but greater.

name: Hand Crossbow

name: Handaxe
description: Good for chopping wood and heads.

name: Heavy Crossbow

name: Hidden Gun Upgrade 1
description: A pistol concealed in the forearm, can be used as part of the attack action. If concealed, the first attack is at advantage, taking the enemy by surprise. Can be done only once per encounter with this hidden weapon. Reload properties still apply.

childItems.description: A pistol concealed in the forearm. If concealed, the first attack is at advantage, taking the enemy by surprise.

name: Hunting Rifle
description: Accels at hunting even the most dangerous game.

name: Hunting Trap

debuff.description: Creature's Speed is reduced to O until the start of its next turn. Thereafter, until the creature breaks free of the trap, its movement is limited by the length of the chain (typically 3 feet). A creature can use its action to make a DC 13 Strength (Athletics) check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Each failed check deals 1 Piercing damage to the trapped creature.

description: As a Utilize action, you can set a Hunting Trap, which is a sawtooth steel ring that snaps shut when a creature steps on a pressure plate in the center. The trap is affixed by a heavy chain to an immobile object, such as a tree or a spike driven into the ground. A creature that steps on the plate must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 1d4 Piercing damage and have its Speed reduced to O until the start of its next turn. Thereafter, until the creature breaks free of the trap, its movement is limited by the length of the chain (typically 3 feet). A creature can use its action to make a DC 13 Strength (Athletics) check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Each failed check deals 1 Piercing damage to the trapped creature.

name: Iron Golem's Might

buff.description: Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing and Slashing damage.

debuff.description: All reduced damage taken all at once when effect ends.

calculation.value: Iron Golem's Might. Any Bludgeoning, Piercing or Slashing damage reduced via resistance must be tracked. When the effect of Iron Golem's Might ends, all reduced damage is taken all at once.

description: This iridescent liquid grants the drinker something approaching resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage for one minute, but can continue for up to five minutes provided the user takes at least 1 point of damage each round. The damage reduction must be tracked for the duration as the drinker will suffer all of that damage in a single lump after the effect ends. This damage cannot be further reduced as it is simply the mind catching up to what very well may be beyond fatal damage.

name: Javelin
description: A spear designed primarily to be thrown.

name: Lance
description: Long pointy stick that can be one-handed if you are mounted: Better go buy a horse.

name: Leatherworker's Tools
utilize: Add a design to a leather item (DC 10)

name: Light Crossbow
description: -and you call this thing the 'Light Crossbow' despite the fact that it lacks the 'Light' property?

name: Light Hammer
description: A fine tool both in and out of combat. Famously sold by Tessler Kefflin.

name: Longbow
description: Like a bow: but longer.

name: Longsword
description: Like a sword: but longer.

name: Mace
description: A heavy club, typically having a metal head and spikes. Favored weapon of many iconic Clerics.

name: Manacles

debuff.description: While bound, a creature has Disadvantage on attack rolls, and the creature is Restrained if the Manacles are attached to a chain or hook that is fixed in place. Escaping the Manacles requires a successful DC 20 Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check as an action. Bursting them requires a successful DC 25 Strength (Athletics) check as an action.

description: As a Utilize action, you can use Manacles to bind an unwilling Small or Medium creature within 5 feet of yourself that has the Grappled, Incapacitated, or Restrained condition if you succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check. While bound, a creature has Disadvantage on attack rolls, and the creature is Restrained if the Manacles are attached to a chain or hook that is fixed in place. Escaping the Manacles requires a successful DC 20 Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check as an action. Bursting them requires a successful DC 25 Strength (Athletics) check as an action.

name: Mason's Tools
utilize: Chisel a symbol or hole in stone (DC 10)

name: Maul
description: Like a hammer: but greater.

name: Milk of Potash

debuff.description: Become poisoned for an hour after the effect of the potion wears off.

calculation.value: Milk of Potash. Advantage against poison.
Milk of Potash. Advantage against poison.

description: The imbiber ceases to taste for 30 minutes during and after drinking, after which point they will universally report the distant aftertaste of having licked a piece of coal. Those who consume it have advantage against poison for 30 minutes, but become poisoned for an hour afterwards.

name: Morningstar
description: Not a great star to see pointed at you in the morning.

name: Oil

debuff.description: Target takes 5 extra Fire damage when taking Fire damage while covered in burning oil or 5 Fire damage is dealt to any creature that enters or ends its turn in a space with lit Oil.

description: You can douse a creature, object, or space with Oil or use it as fuel, as detailed below. Dousing a Creature or an Object. When you take the Attack action, you can replace one of your attacks with throwing an Oil flask. Target one creature or object within 20 feet of yourself. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Dexterity modifier and Proficiency Bonus) or be covered in oil. If the target takes Fire damage before the oil dries (after 1 minute), the target takes an extra 5 Fire damage from burning oil. Dousing a Space. You can take the Utilize action to pour an Oil flask on level ground to cover a 5-footsquare area within 5 feet of yourself. If lit, the oil burns until the end of the turn 2 rounds from when the oil was lit (or 12 seconds) and deals 5 Fire damage to any creature that enters the area or ends its turn there. A creature can take this damage only once per turn. Fuel. Oil serves as fuel for Lamps and Lanterns. Once lit, a flask of Oil burns for 6 hours in a Lamp or Lantern. That duration doesn't need to be consecutive; you can extinguish the burning Oil (as a Utilize action) and rekindle it again until it has burned for a total of 6 hours.

name: Painter's Supplies
utilize: Paint a recognizable image of something (DC 10)

name: Palm Pistol
description: A small single-shot pistol designed to be concealed in the palm of the hand.

name: Parchment of the Stenographarian
description: When attuned, the parchment will magically write down everything you say. Your works will appear on the parchment, as you say them. There is a catch, however. It will write down EVERYTHING you say (even coughs and sighs), and as there is only one piece of parchment - when it reaches the bottom of the page - it starts anew at the top, overwriting whatever was there. You need to stay very quiet if you want your words kept for posterity. The parchment says attuned to you as long as you live, and it will record your words, no matter how far away it is from you, and no matter what plane or planet may separate you.

name: Pepperbox
description: A late renaissance style pistol, the pepperbox deals the same damage as a standard flintlock but offers a revolving barrel for multiple shots before reload.

name: Pike
description: Long pushy stick. Why it so heavy tho?

name: Pistol
description: A pistol with a four-round capacity cylinder. When viewed from front or rear the cylinder seems to resemble a four-leaf clover.

name: Plate Armor
description: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.

calculation.value: Plate Armor. Speed is reduced by 10 because Strength score is below 15.
Plate Armor. The wearer has disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

name: Potion of Greater Healing
description: This potion is a magic item. As a Bonus Action, you can drink it or administer it to another creature within 5 feet of yourself. The creature that drinks the magical red fluid in this vial regains 4d4+4 Hit Points. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

name: Potion of Healing
description: This potion is a magic item. As a Bonus Action, you can drink it or administer it to another creature within 5 feet of yourself. The creature that drinks the magical red fluid in this vial regains 2d4+2 Hit Points. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

name: Potion of Superior Healing
description: This potion is a magic item. As a Bonus Action, you can drink it or administer it to another creature within 5 feet of yourself. The creature that drinks the magical red fluid in this vial regains 8d4+8 Hit Points. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

name: Potion of Supreme Healing
description: This potion is a magic item. As a Bonus Action, you can drink it or administer it to another creature within 5 feet of yourself. The creature that drinks the magical red fluid in this vial regains 10d4+20 Hit Points. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

name: Potter's Tools
utilize: Discern what a ceramic object held in the past 24 hours (DC 15)

name: Prismatic Mantle of Spellfire

attunementRequirements.description: Must be a Sorcerer of Spellfire

description: This shimmering mantle is woven from raw strands of the Weave itself, pulsating with shifting hues of the rainbow. As the wearer's power grows, the colors awaken, granting additional magical abilities. Prismatic Unleashing. As the sorcerer grows in power, they unlock the individual colors of the mantle. Each color grants a passive ability, but you can only use abilities of that color that you have activated. You can change the cloak's color once per day. Grey does not have any powers and is cosmetic. Abilities: Black Passive: You gain a +1 bonus to AC. White Passive: Your spell save DC and spell attack bonus each increase by +1. Red - Embers of the First Flame Passive: You gain resistance to fire damage. Active - Inferno Pulse: As part of your innate sorcery, you can ignite yourself in Spellfire. For the next minute, you shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and all your spell damage ignores resistance to fire and radiant damage.

actions.name: Change Mantle Color
actions.description: Each color grants a passive ability, but you can only use abilities of that color that you have activated. You can change the cloak's color once per day.

calculation.value: color
Prismatic Mantle of Spellfire - White. Your spell save DC increases by 1.
Prismatic Mantle of Spellfire - White. Your spell attack bonus increases by 1.

Prismatic Mantle of Spellfire - Inferno Pulse. As part of your innate sorcery, you can ignite yourself in Spellfire. For the next minute, you shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and all your spell damage ignores resistance to fire and radiant damage..
Prismatic Mantle of Spellfire - Inferno Pulse. All your spell damage ignores resistance to fire and radiant damage.

name: Quarterstaff
description: A staff that is larger than a quarter.

name: Rapier
description: A great way for weak bitches that don't use magic to still do something in combat.

name: Ration
description: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts. Perfectly portioned for 1 day's time.

name: Revolver
description: This is the greatest handgun ever made. Six bullets. More than enough to kill anything that moves.

name: Scale Mail
description: AC: 14 + Dex modifier (max 2). This armor consists of a coat and leggings (and perhaps a separate skirt) of leather covered with overlapping pieces of metal, much like the scales of a fish. The suit includes gauntlets. Stealth. The wearer has disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

name: Scimitar
description: Like a sword: but curvier.

name: Shortsword
description: Like a sword: but shorter.

name: Shield
description: AC: 2. A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

name: Shield of Evasion
description: A shield that magically evades projectiles, leaving you wide open as it moves out of the way of any incoming projectiles. Giving you -1 AC.

name: Shortbow
description: Isn't this a little short for a bow?

name: Sickle

name: Sling
description: Time to slay some Goliaths.

name: Smith's Tools

craft: Any Melee weapon (except Club, Greatclub, Quarterstaff and Whip)

name: Spear
description: A spear designed primarily to jab people with.

name: Studded Leather Armor
description: AC: 12 + Dex modifier. Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

calculation.value: dexterityModifier

name: The Ring of Spotlight
description: This magical item grants the user advantage on Performance checks. Magically a single light shines down from above onto the user like a spotlight upon making any performance check while wearing this. You automatically fail any stealth checks while this is active.

calculation.value: The Ring of Spotlight. Advantage on Performance checks as a single light Magically shines down from above onto you.
The Ring of Spotlight. You automatically fail any stealth checks while the Ring of Spotlight is active.

name: Tinkerer's Tools
utilize: Assemble a Tiny item composed of scrap, which falls apart in 1 minute (DC 20)

name: Trident
description: Who the fuck do you think you are weilding this thing?! King Neptune?!

name: Tumbler Mouse
description:
A small, clockwork mouse that scurries around a room before finding a person and performing a clumsy somersault.

Can cast Find Familiar to summon a clockwork rodent once per long rest.

actions.name: Find Familiar - Clockwork Mouse
actions.description: You gain the service of a familiar, a spirit that takes an animal form of a Clockwork Mouse. Appearing in an unoccupied space within range, the familiar has the statistics of the chosen form, though it is a Celestial, Fey, or Fiend (your choice) instead of a Beast. Your familiar acts independently of you, but it obeys your commands. Telepathic Connection. While your familiar is within 100 feet of you, you can communicate with it telepathically. Additionally, as a Bonus Action, you can see through the familiar's eyes and hear what it hears until the start of your next turn, gaining the benefits of any special senses it has. Finally, when you cast a spell with a range of touch, your familiar can deliver the touch. Your familiar must be within 100 feet of you, and it must take a Reaction to deliver the touch when you cast the spell. Combat. The familiar is an ally to you and your allies. It rolls its own Initiative and acts on its own turn. A familiar can't attack, but it can take other actions as normal. Disappearance of the Familiar. When the familiar drops to 0 Hit Points, it disappears. It reappears after you cast this spell again. As a Magic action, you can temporarily dismiss the familiar to a pocket dimension. Alternatively, you can dismiss it forever. As a Magic action while it is temporarily dismissed, you can cause it to reappear in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you. Whenever the familiar drops to 0 Hit Points or disappears into the pocket dimension, it leaves behind in its space anything it was wearing or carrying. One Familiar Only. You can't have more than one familiar at a time. If you cast this spell while you have a familiar, you instead cause it to adopt a new eligible form.

calculation.value: Clockwork Mouse

name: Vase of Cancer
description: When the user opens the lid, any nearby crabs will look in its direction for a small amount of time.

name: Warhammer
description: Like an hammer: but for war.

name: War Pick
description: Like an pick: but for war.

name: Whip
